class_notes:
French 102 continues the work begun in French 101 and builds studentsÂ¿ skills in speaking, writing, reading, and understanding French; and continues introducing them to the cultures of France and the French-speaking world. 
Students with past experience in French (other than French 101) must have received a French 102 placement recommendation or have instructor permission to enroll. 
Required course materials: Anderson and Dolidon, En Avant! Beginning French, third edition. Access code for digital edition and online workbook (Connect) is required (ISBN 978-1-26026-750-1). 
Assessment: Engaged participation, daily practice exercises, short writing assignments, eight chapter quizzes, five graded one-on-one conversations.
course_description: This beginning-level course focuses on all aspects of communicating in French: in-class and group activities, reading, writing short compositions, listening, and speaking. Particular attention will be given to reading stories in French.
